required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Long-term Safety, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics Study of Lubiprostone in Paediatric Subjects Aged ≥ 6 Years to < 18 Years With Functional Constipation

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is for children with constipation.
Children who completed 3 months of treatment in the earlier study (NCT02042183):
- were invited to participate
- will receive lubiprostone for 9 more months
- will see if lubiprostone safely relieves their constipation if taken for a whole year

primary_outcome.measure: Median Number of Observed Weekly Spontaneous Bowel Movements (SBM) Per Month
primary_outcome.description: Spontaneous bowel movements are defined as bowel movements without the aid of drugs.

other_outcome.measure: Median Monthly Score on a 5-point Straining Scale Associated With Observed SBMs
other_outcome.description: Straining during observed SBMs is rated on a 5-point scale where 1=no straining and 5=extreme straining. A higher value is worse.

other_outcome.measure: Median Monthly Score on a Stool Consistency Scale Associated With Observed SBMs
other_outcome.description: Stool consistency is rated on a 5-Point Stool Consistency Scale, where 1=normal and 5=very hard. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Median Monthly Score on a 4-point Pain Scale for Observed Abdominal Pain
other_outcome.description: Abdominal pain was rated on a scale from 1 (no pain) to 4 (very severe pain). A higher score means a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Participants receive lubiprostone twice daily Participants must have completed the entire 12-week treatment period during the preceding study. Those who received 12 mcg twice daily (BID) continued to receive 12 mcg, those who received 24 mcg BID continued with that dose.Those of the placebo arm in the previous study weighing less than 50 kg received 12 mcg BID and over 50 kg received 24 mcg BID during this study.

intervention.description: 12 or 24 mcg soft capsules for oral administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has completed the 3-month placebo-controlled study (NCT02042183)
- Will continue to abstain from taking concomitant medication (prescribed or over-the-counter) that affects gastrointestinal motility
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has untreated faecal impaction at the time of rolling over into study
- Has significant change in medical status, newly diagnosed and uncontrolled cardiovascular, liver or lung disease, neurologic or psychiatric disorder, or other systemic disease
- Has demonstrated non-compliance with study protocol during the 3-month placebo-controlled study (NCT02042183)

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants who completed the 3-month placebo-controlled study (NCT02042183) were invited to enroll in this safety extension study lasting an additional 9 months.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

reported_events.time_frame: from first open-label dose to last open-label dose plus 7 days (9 months, 7 days)
reported_events.desc: Only treatment-emergent adverse events (AEs) are reported. Adverse events with onset dates after the administration of the first open-label dose and prior to the last open-label dose plus 7 days are considered treatment-emergent.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
